Name: Gauls
History: The Gauls were the Celtic tribes of continental Europe. Dominated by a priestly class of Druids, they featured a sophisticated culture of advanced metalworking, agriculture, trade and even road engineering. With heavy infantry and cavalry, Gallic warriors valiantly resisted Caesar's campaign of conquest and Rome's authoritarian rule.

Technologies.Name: Late Armies (Reform)
Technologies.History: Late Gallic armies included an increased number of men armored in chainmail.
Technologies.Description: +1 hack and +1 pierce armor for melee infantry and cavalry units. Unlocks the training of champion units at the barracks.

Technologies.Name: Great Migration
Technologies.History: The Gauls often relocated en mass. One prime example is the Galatian invasion of the Balkans which concluded with a large portion of them settling in the middle of Asia Minor and another one in Eastern Thrace.

Technologies.Name: Trimarchisia
Technologies.History: A special tactic used by Gallic horsemen involving extra horses and servants allowing them to rest while maintaining constant pressure on the enemy.
Technologies.Description: Cavalry units will regenerate health rapidly over time when idle.

CivBonuses.Name: Carnutes
CivBonuses.History: Celtic religion and druidry inspired their warlike mindset.
CivBonuses.Description: Druids increase the attack damage of soldiers near them by 1.

CivBonuses.Name: Celtic Valour
CivBonuses.History: The individual's courage and deeds in close combat were considered as the ultimate form of bravery in Celtic societies. Many warriors charged fiercely in battle, often being ill-equipped with poor weapons and no armor.
CivBonuses.Description: Non-Champion melee infantry +10% walk and run speed, -20% hit points and -10% wood/metal cost.

CivBonuses.Name: Wooden Construction
CivBonuses.History: Celtic structures were mostly made of wood with rubble foundations. Consequently, their structures have less health than other cultures do, but they also construct faster.
CivBonuses.Description: Structures construct 20% faster but are also 20% weaker. Most Structures provide +5 population.

CivBonuses.Name: Herding
CivBonuses.Description: The Gauls start the game with an extra sheep.

TeamBonuses.Name: Foreign Service
TeamBonuses.History: Many Gauls served in foreign armies as mercenaries, settler troops or parts of elite/royal guard units.
TeamBonuses.Description: 10% decreased train time for Champion and Mercenary units (currently not shared).

Structures.Name: Melonas
Structures.History: The Celts developed the first rotary flour mill.
Structures.Description: 25% increased farming rate for nearby farms.
